We honor those whose names we know, and those who names we will never know. May their souls and their families find solace.

Migration is a human right.
This dia de los muertos, we want to honor all those who have died at the hands of harmful U.S. immigration policies. No one should die on their journey to seek safety and refuge.
We set up altars to help guide our loved ones, and offer them their favorite things.

Dia de los muertos is celebrated on November 1st & 2nd throughout many places in Latin America and the U.S.. The belief is that this is the time that we are closer to the veil between death and life, and that our loved ones closest to us. #DiaDeLosMuertos #DayOfTheDead https://t.co/RFl20ENdbt
